title: Weather update: Delhi braces for downpour; red alert in Ajmer, orange in Himachal Pradesh - CNBC TV18
article_text:
Weather update: Delhi braces for downpour; red alert in Ajmer, orange in Himachal Pradesh
Delhi and the neighbouring regions of Noida and Gurugram continue to experience heavy rains. Maharashtra, Gujarat and Goa may receive heavy rainfall on Tuesday, other regions such as West Bengal and Jharkhand are likely to experience extremely heavy rain.
By CNBCTV18.com 
July 15, 2025, 10:31:59 AM IST (Published)
4 Min Read
The India Meteorological Department on Tuesday, July 15, forecast widespread rainfall across states until July 20, with heavy to very heavy showers expected in several regions.



While Maharashtra, Gujarat and Goa may receive heavy rainfall on Tuesday, other regions such as West Bengal and Jharkhand are likely to experience extremely heavy rain.


With the monsoon season in full swing, Delhi and the neighbouring regions of Noida and Gurugram continue to experience heavy rains. According to the IMD, rain is expected across Delhi on Tuesday, with the chance of thunderstorms and lightning.

In Himachal Pradesh, an orange alert has been issued for six districts. Speaking with PTI, Sandeep Kumar Sharma, Senior Scientist at the Shimla Meteorological Centre, said, “For July 14 and 15, we expect light to moderate rainfall in most mid-hill and low-hill districts. However, Kangra, Mandi, and Sirmaur districts are under orange alert for today due to the likelihood of heavy to heavy rainfall, and this activity will continue tomorrow as well."

The Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for extremely heavy rainfall in Nagaur, Ajmer, and Pali districts of Rajasthan on Tuesday. It has also issued an orange alert for ten districts, including Tonk, Bikaner, Jodhpur, Jalore, and Bhilwara.

Weather Forecast and Warnings

Northwest India

In its latest bulletin, the IMD predicted extremely heavy rainfall (≥21 cm) at isolated places over Rajasthan on July 15.

Isolated heavy rainfall is likely over Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, east Uttar Pradesh from July 15 to 20, Jammu and Kashmir from July 15 to 17, Punjab on July 16, west Uttar Pradesh from July 16 to 20, Rajasthan from July 15 to 17, with very heavy rainfall over Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand on July 15; west Rajasthan on July 16; and east Uttar Pradesh on July 16 and 17.

Light/moderate rainfall at most/many places accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning is likely over the western Himalayan region and some/many places over the plains during the next seven days.

East and Central India

Extremely heavy rainfall (≥21 cm) is very likely at isolated places over Jharkhand on July 15. Isolated heavy rainfall is very likely to continue over west Madhya Pradesh from July 15 to 18, east Madhya Pradesh, Odisha from July 15 to 20, Chhattisgarh, Bihar on July 15 and 16, Andaman and Nicobar Islands on July 15; Sub Himalayan West Bengal and Sikkim on July 15, 19 and 20 with very heavy rainfall over east Madhya Pradesh on July 16 and 17, Jharkhand on July 15 and 16, Odisha and Gangetic West Bengal on July 15 and Bihar on July 15 and 16.

The IMD predicted light/moderate rainfall at most/many places, accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning over the region during the next seven days, with moderate to intense lightning over Bihar today.

West India

Heavy rainfall is likely at isolated places over Gujarat on July 15. The IMD predicted light/moderate rainfall at many places over the region during the next five days.

Northeast India

Light/moderate rainfall at many places, accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning, is likely to continue over Northeast India in the next seven days. Isolated heavy rainfall is very likely over Assam, Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh, Mizoram and Tripura from July 15 to 16, with very heavy rainfall over Assam and Meghalaya on July 15.

South Peninsular India

Isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Kerala, Mahe, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka from July 15 to 20, Tamil Nadu from July 15 to 19, isolated heavy rain over Lakshadweep on July 19 and 20, coastal Andhra Pradesh and Yanam from July 18 to 20, Rayalaseema on July 18 and 19. Strong surface winds (speed reaching 40-50 kmph) are very likely over South Peninsular India during the next few days.

Light/moderate rainfall at many/some places over Kerala, Mahe, Lakshadweep, Karnataka, and Rayalaseema; isolated to scattered rainfall over coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, and Telangana during the next seven days.

Hot and Humid Weather Warnings

Hot and humid weather conditions are very likely in isolated pockets of Tamil Nadu, Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam and Rayalaseema on July 15.

title: Maharashtra: Raigad Declares Holiday For Schools & Colleges In 6 Talukas Amid Red Alert For Heavy Rain - Free Press Journal
article_text:
Navi Mumbai: In light of the red alert issued by the India Meteorological Department (IMD) for extremely heavy rainfall in parts of Raigad district, District Collector Kishan N. Jawale has declared a holiday for all educational institutions in six talukas on Monday, July 15.

About The Talukas Affected By The Order

The talukas affected by the order include Mangaon, Tala, Roha, Pali, Mahad, and Poladpur, where continuous overnight rainfall and strong winds have caused rivers, especially the Kundalika River, to cross warning levels. These areas have also been experiencing high tides and stormy weather conditions.

Based on reports from the Sub-Divisional Officers of Mangaon, Roha, and Mahad, and after reviewing the local situation, the district administration took the decision as a precautionary measure to ensure the safety of students.

FPJ Shorts
Mumbai News: 50-Year-Old Woman Dies After Being Hit By Car Near Bandra-Worli Sea Link; Driver Detained
Mumbai's 1000-Year-Old Shiva Temple At Ambarnath Is Known For These Amazing Facts
Watch Live: Indian Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's Touch Down On Earth With Splashdown Off California Coast
‘4 RDX IED Bombs Placed In Tower...': Bombay Stock Exchange Receives Bomb Threat
Read Also
US Supreme Court Allows President Donald Trump To Proceed With Education Department Dismantling...

The holiday applies to all government and private primary and secondary schools, Zilla Parishad and municipal schools, aided and unaided schools, all ashram schools, Anganwadis, colleges, and institutions under the Commissioner of Vocational Education and Training in the affected talukas, confirmed and order issued by Raigad collector Kishan Jawale.

However, the order mandates that all headmasters, teachers, and non-teaching staff report to their institutions during regular hours and remain available to assist the local administration with disaster management duties, if required.

The directive was issued under the powers vested in the District Collector as the Chairperson of the District Disaster Management Authority, in accordance with the Disaster Management Act, 2005, and relevant government guidelines.

The Raigad administration has urged residents in affected areas to remain alert and follow official advisories.

Cloudy skies are also expected in the city which is expected to remain the same throughout the day. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert in some regions of Karnataka.

The city woke up at 06: 01 AM. The minimum and maximum temperatures are expected to range from 21 degrees Celsius to 27 degrees Celsius, respectively. The city is expected to witness sunset at 06: 50 PM. The weather department said that rain and cloudy skies will keep the temperatures mild and pleasant in the city.

title: Monsoon Update: Heavy rain warning in these states till July 17 - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Alert: The country’s capital, Delh,i and the adjoining areas are witnessing the wrath of rain. Two days ago, normal life was disrupted due to heavy rains accompanied by y storm in the west. Many farmers lost their lives due to the falling of trees and the uprooting of electricity poles, due to which the roads were also blocked.

Due to late-night rains in some parts of Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand, the temperature level decreased. As a result, people got relief from the heat. The situation has worsened due to continuous monsoon rains in many areas of Bihar and Chhattisgarh. Rain has also disrupted normal life in Rajasthan. The Indian Meteorological Department has issued a warning of heavy rains in various parts of the country.

Rain alert in these districts of Uttar Pradesh

The Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rains in Bahraich, Balrampur, Gonda, Azamgarh and Jaunpur. Apart from these, a ain alert has been issued in Maharajganj, Varanasi, Chandauli, Mirzapur, and Ambedkar Nagar. Heavy rain can also be seen in Chandauli, Prayagraj and Ballia. Drizzle can be seen in some parts of Moradabad, Amroha, Bijnor and Saharanpur.

Rain warning in Himachal

According to IMD, a heavy rain warning has been issued in Himachal Pradesh till July 17. Anyway, rain havoc has been going on here for the past few days. A period of rain can be seen in the Kota, Jaipur, Ajmer, and Jodhpur divisions of Rajasthan.

Possibility of rain in many states

There is also a possibility of rain with thunder and strong winds in Telangana, Maharashtra and Karnataka. There is a possibility of rain in various districts of Maharashtra and Gujarat. Sikkim, Manipur, and Puducherry may witness heavy rains. Heavy rains are expected in Arunachal Pradesh, Tripura, Mizoram and Nagaland.

title: Chennai Weather Update: Light To Moderate Rainfall Is Predicted In Some Parts Of Tamil Nadu; Check Details - Free Press Journal
article_text:
Chennai: The capital city is known as the Gateway to South India, and usually experiences hot and humid weather conditions during the summer and early monsoon months. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a mix of rain and scorching heat across Tamil Nadu over the next few days.

The city's weather is expected to remain warm and humid, with occasional chances of light rainfall due to the ongoing Southwest Monsoon influence. On Tuesday, the capital city woke up at 05: 50 AM and the sun is likely to set at 6: 40 PM. Today, the minimum and maximum temperatures are likely to be around 29 degrees Celsius and 35 degrees Celsius, respectively. The humidity is expected to be around 72 per cent.

Today's weather

The Regional Meteorological Department (RMC) has predicted rainfall to continue over Tamil Nadu. Other parts of the state will experience light rainfall, and it is likely to be accompanied by thunderstorms. The temperatures are expected to remain above normal, causing discomfort in several regions.

The city may experience gusty winds. Chennai is likely to experience light to moderate rainfall. Meanwhile, rainfall is also predicted in districts, including Western Ghats, Puducherry, Karaikal, Nilgiris, Tenkasi, Coimbatore, Tirunelveli, Theni, Kancheepuram, Chengalpattu, Ariyalur, and Perambalur until the weekend. The skies are expected to be cloudy, and it will remain the same throughout the day.

Cyclonic circulation is influencing the rainfall

The rainfall is likely due to a cyclonic circulation over the Southeast Bay of Bengal and the adjoining South Andaman Sea. The weather department also stated that, apart from Tamil Nadu, rainfall is likely to occur in other states, including Odisha, Karnataka, West Bengal, Maharashtra, and Telangana.

Weather tips

If you're planning to go outdoors, it's advisable to stay hydrated and wear light, breathable clothing. Keeping an umbrella handy could help in case of sudden rain spells. It's also a good idea to avoid outdoor activities during peak afternoon hours when the heat and humidity are at their highest.

title: Torrential rain triggers flash flooding in New York, New Jersey - dtnext
article_text:
Flash floods hit New Jersey (Image source: X)
NEW YORK: Torrential rains lashed parts of the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic, unleashing severe flash flooding across New York City and northern New Jersey, prompting emergency alerts, evacuations, and widespread disruption.
New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy declared a state of emergency late Monday.
Taking to X, he posted, "I am declaring a State of Emergency given flash flooding and high levels of rainfall in parts of the state. Please stay indoors and avoid unnecessary travel. Stay safe, New Jersey."
The National Weather Service also issued flash flood warnings for all five boroughs of New York City, as heavy storms dropped more than an inch of rain in areas such as Staten Island and Manhattan by early evening on Monday.
Forecasts warned of continued rainfall through the night.
The New York City authorities warned residents, especially those living in basement apartments, to be prepared for sudden evacuations.
In a post on X, New York City Emergency Management posted, "If you live in a basement flat, stay alert. Flash flooding can happen with little warning, including overnight."
"Keep a phone, torch, and Go Bag nearby. Be ready to move to higher ground," the authorities added.
Emergency data showed Manhattan's Chelsea neighbourhood recorded 1.47 inches of rainfall by 7:30 p.m., while Staten Island had seen 1.67 inches.
In neighbouring New Jersey, towns such as Plainfield and Metuchen faced some of the most severe impacts.
Authorities in both New York and New Jersey maintained a heightened state of alert into the night, watching over flood-prone regions and warning of the potential for worsening conditions.
More rainfall is expected across the cities, and emergency crews are deployed across affected zones to focus on public safety and rapid response.

title: Chennai To Face Power Outage On July 15, Check List Of Affected Areas And Timings - MSN
article_text:
Several neighbourhoods across Chennai will experience a scheduled power outage on Tuesday, 15 July 2025, as the Tamil Nadu Electricity Board (TNEB) carries out routine maintenance work. The temporary power cut will affect a wide stretch of the city, and residents are being advised to plan ahead.
According to TNEB officials, electricity will be suspended from 9:00 am to 2:00 pm in the affected localities. The maintenance work is part of the board’s periodic effort to ensure the safety and efficiency of its infrastructure.
“Residents are requested to cooperate with field staff during the outage. Power supply will resume as soon as the work is completed,” the board said in a statement quoted by News18 Tamil.

With the shutdown spanning five hours, TNEB has advised residents to make suitable arrangements, especially those dependent on continuous power for health equipment, remote work, or small-scale commercial activity.
A brain stroke is a medical emergency where every second counts. Recognizing the signs and taking immediate action is crucial. It could mean the difference between life and death. Dr. Raveesh Sunkara, a board-certified neurosurgeon based in Hyderabad, has listed the 3 most common and crucial signs of a brain stroke, and why it is important to act ‘FAST’. “Recognizing these stroke symptoms quickly can save a brain and a life,” he said.
The first sign of a stroke is visible changes in facial asymmetry. Dr. Sunkara said that a stroke leads to the drooping of one side of the face. The individual will find it difficult to smile evenly. If you see someone having a droopy face all of a sudden, ask the person to smile. If one side doesn’t move or appears drooped, it’s a red flag. This symptom occurs because the stroke disrupts the brain’s control over facial muscles, typically on one side. Recognizing this early sign and taking swift action can potentially prevent severe brain damage.
Another critical sign is weakness or numbness in one arm or leg. You can do a quick test in such circumstances. Ask the person to raise both arms. If one arm drifts downward or can’t be lifted, it’s a strong indicator of a stroke. This happens due to the impaired brain signals to the limbs, often affecting one side of the body. When the weakness affects the legs, it may cause difficulty walking or balancing.
One of the most common signs of a stroke is disturbances in speech. Their words may be slurred, struggle to speak, or produce confused speech. One simple way to recognize this is to ask them to repeat a simple sentence. If they can’t, or it sounds unclear, act immediately. Disturbances in speech happen when a stroke affects the brain’s language centers and impairs communication. When combined with other signs, speech difficulty is a clear call to seek emergency help.
How to remember these crucial signs? Just think of acting ‘FAST’.
Dr. Sunkara urges everyone to memorize the F.A.S.T. acronym to recognize stroke symptoms quickly. “F for face, A for weakness of arms, S for speech, and T is time.” Yes, that’s right. Time is the most important step. Brain cells die rapidly during a stroke. How immediately you act and get the person to a hospital within the first few hours can make all the difference. Delaying treatment risks permanent disability or even death.

“If you see any of these signs, it's TIME TO CALL EMERGENCY SERVICES IMMEDIATELY,” he said.
Disclaimer: This article is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the guidance of a qualified healthcare provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition. If you suspect someone is having a stroke, call emergency services immediately. Time is critical in stroke management.

title: Rajasthan Rain Alert: भारी बारिश से पानी-पानी हुआ राजस्थान, आज 10 से अधिक जिलों में ऑरेंज अलर्ट - NDTV Rajasthan
article_text:
Rajasthan Rain Alert: भारी बारिश से पानी-पानी हुआ राजस्थान, आज 10 से अधिक जिलों में ऑरेंज अलर्ट
Rajasthan Rain Alert: मानसून की सक्रियता से पूर्वी भारत और पश्चिमी राजस्थान में अगले 24 से 48 घंटे महत्वपूर्ण रहेंगे. कृषि, यातायात और जल प्रबंधन से जुड़े विभागों को अलर्ट पर रहने की सलाह दी गई है.
Written by:
श्यामजी तिवारी
राजस्थान न्यूज़
जुलाई 15, 2025 06:10 am IST

Last Updated On
जुलाई 15, 2025 06:10 am IST
Read Time:
3 mins
Share

Rajasthan Weather: बीते 24 घंटे के दौरान राजस्थान के कोटा, उदयपुर और जोधपुर संभाग में मूसलाधार बारिश हुई है. सबसे ज्यादा कोटा के खातोली में 198 मिमी बारिश दर्ज की गई है. जयपुर मौसम केंद्र के मुताबिक, राजस्थान में मानसून गतिविधियों को बल देने वाला दबाव का क्षेत्र पूर्वोत्तर हिस्से में सक्रिय है. यह सिस्टम अगले दो दिनों तक राजस्थान के कई हिस्सों में आगे बढ़ेगा, जिससे जयपुर, अलवर, सीकर, झुंझुनूं, भरतपुर, कोटा, अजमेर, बांसवाड़ा, भीलवाड़ा और चित्तौड़गढ़ जिलों में मध्यम से भारी बारिश की संभावना है.

अगले 24 से 48 घंटे महत्वपूर्ण 

मानसून की सक्रियता से पूर्वी भारत और पश्चिमी राजस्थान में अगले 24 से 48 घंटे महत्वपूर्ण रहेंगे. कृषि, यातायात और जल प्रबंधन से जुड़े विभागों को अलर्ट पर रहने की सलाह दी गई है. आमजन को भी सावधानी बरतने और मौसम विभाग के अपडेट पर नजर बनाए रखने की जरूरत है. 

आज कई जिलों में भारी बारिश

मौसम विभाग ने बताया कि पश्चिमी राजस्थान के बाड़मेर, जालोर और जैसलमेर में भी बारिश की गतिविधियों में तेजी आ सकती है. 15 जुलाई यानी मंगलवार को कोटा, अजमेर और जोधपुर संभाग के कुछ हिस्सों में अतिभारी बारिश व कहीं-कहीं अत्यंत भारी बारिश की उम्मीद है. इसके अलावा जयपुर, भरतपुर और बीकानेर संभाग में भी कहीं-कहीं मध्यम से भारी बारिश का दौर जारी रहने की संभावना है. 

तीन जिलों में रेड अलर्ट

बड़ी बात है कि मौसम विभाग ने अजमेर, नागौर और पाली में मंगलवार के लिए भारी बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया है. पूर्वी राजस्थान के भीलवाड़ा, बूंदी, चित्तौड़गढ़, कोटा, राजसमंद, सिरोही और टोंक में ऑरेंज अलर्ट है. इसके अलावा पश्चिमी राजस्थान के बीकानेर, जालौर और जोधपुर में भी मंगलवार के लिए ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया गया है.

17 जुलाई से बारिश में आएगी कमी

वहीं, 16 जुलाई को जोधपुर, बीकानेर, अजमेर संभाग के कुछ भागों में भारी बारिश व कहीं कहीं-कहीं अतिभारी बारिश होने की प्रबल संभावना है. पूर्वी राजस्थान में भारी बारिश की गतिविधियों में 17 जुलाई से पश्चिमी राजस्थान में 18 जुलाई से कमी दर्ज होने की प्रबल संभावना है.

यह भी पढे़ं-

कोटा में बारिश बनी आफत, तेज बहाव में बह गए 6 लोग; स्कूटी के साथ बही छात्रा की मौत

राजस्थान में भारी बारिश यात्रियों की परेशानी बढ़ी... कई ट्रेनों का रूट बदला, लूनी-मारवाड़ रेलमार्ग बाधित

title: Rajasthan Weather: भारी बारिश से थम सा गया राजस्थान! ट्रेनें रद्द, 12 मौतें, 10 हज़ार से ज़्यादा लोग घरों में कैद रहने को मजबूर - NDTV Rajasthan
article_text:
Rajasthan Weather: भारी बारिश से थम सा गया राजस्थान! ट्रेनें रद्द, 12 मौतें, 10 हजार से ज्यादा लोग घरों में कैद
Rajasthan Monsoon: राजस्थान में मानसून अब धीरे-धीरे मुसीबत का सबब बनता जा रहा है. हाड़ौती समेत दक्षिण-पूर्वी राजस्थान में हालात सबसे ज़्यादा गंभीर हैं, जहां कॉलोनियां पानी में डूब गई हैं, ट्रेनें रद्द कर दी गई हैं और हाईवे पर जलभराव के कारण यातायात ठप हो गया है. लगभग 10 हज़ार लोग अपने घरों में कैद हैं. 
Written by:
अनामिका मिश्रा
राजस्थान न्यूज़

राजस्थान में मानसून का कहर

Rajasthan Rain: राजस्थान में मानसून पूरी तरह मेहरबान है. लगातार हो रही भारी बारिश ने राज्य के कई हिस्सों में जनजीवन पूरी तरह अस्त-व्यस्त कर दिया है. जिसके चलते यह मानसून अब धीरे-धीरे मुसीबत का सबब बनता जा रहा है. हाड़ौती समेत दक्षिण-पूर्वी राजस्थान में हालात सबसे ज़्यादा गंभीर हैं, जहां कॉलोनियां पानी में डूब गई हैं, ट्रेनें रद्द कर दी गई हैं और हाईवे पर जलभराव के कारण यातायात ठप हो गया है. लगभग 10 हज़ार लोग अपने घरों में कैद हैं. 

12 लोगों की मौत

हालात यह है कि  बारिश से जुड़े हादसों में मरने वालों की संख्या लगभग एक दर्जन पहुंच गई है. कोटा में पिकनिक मनाने गए छह लोग चंबल नदी में लापता हो गए . साथ ही पाली में बिगड़ते हालातों को देखते हुए प्रशासन ने कोटा और पाली में छुट्टी की घोषणा कर दी. लेकिन  सबसे ज़्यादा प्रभावित जिलों में  अब तक 12 लोगों का मौत होने की खबर सामने आई है. जिसमें चित्तौड़गढ़ (4 मौतें), प्रतापगढ़ (3), चूरू (2), कोटा (1), भरतपुर (1) और पाली (1) शामिल हैं.

हाड़ौती और दक्षिण-पूर्वी राजस्थान में भयावह स्थिति

कोटा संभाग में चंबल नदी के उफान पर होने से स्थिति और भी विकट हो गई है. यहां छह लोग नदी में बह गए, जिससे स्थानीय लोगों में दहशत का माहौल है. एक बेहद दुखद घटना में, परीक्षा देने जा रही एक युवती स्कूटी सहित नाले में बह गई, जिससे उसकी मौत हो गई. वहीं, चित्तौड़गढ़ में भी चार लोगों की पानी में बहने से मौत की ख़बर है, जो बारिश के कहर को दर्शाता है.

यातायात और संपर्क प्रभावित

भारी बारिश के कारण कई रास्ते बंद हो गए हैं, जिससे मध्यप्रदेश से राजस्थान का संपर्क भी कट गया है. कई इलाकों में स्कूल और अस्पतालों में भी पानी भर गया है, जिससे आपातकालीन सेवाओं पर भी दबाव बढ़ गया है. शहरों में जलभराव की समस्या इतनी गंभीर है कि कई कॉलोनियों में घरों के अंदर तक पानी घुस गया है, जिससे लोगों को भारी परेशानियों का सामना करना पड़ रहा है.

मौसम विभाग का 'अतिभारी बारिश' का अलर्ट

इस बीच, मौसम विभाग ने आगामी दिनों के लिए एक नया और चिंताजनक अलर्ट जारी किया है. विभाग के अनुसार, कोटा, अजमेर, जयपुर और उदयपुर संभाग के कुछ भागों में भारी से अतिभारी बारिश होने की संभावना है, और कुछ स्थानों पर अत्यंत भारी बारिश भी हो सकती है. यह अलर्ट पहले से ही परेशान लोगों के लिए और चिंता का विषय बन गया है, क्योंकि इससे स्थिति और बिगड़ने की आशंका है.

राहत और बचाव कार्य जारी

राज्य सरकार और स्थानीय प्रशासन राहत और बचाव कार्यों में लगे हुए हैं. प्रभावित इलाकों से लोगों को सुरक्षित स्थानों पर पहुंचाने का प्रयास किया जा रहा है. हालांकि, लगातार बारिश और जलभराव के कारण बचाव कार्यों में भी बाधा आ रही है.

यह भी पढ़ें: Karauli News: कोटा में दर्दनाक सड़क हादसा, परिवार ने एक साथ उठाई मां और दो बेटों की अर्थियां

Rajasthan.NDTV.in पर राजस्थान की ताज़ातरीन ख़बरों को ट्रैक करें. देश और दुनियाभर से न्यूज़ अपडेट पाएं. इसके अलावा, मनोरंजन की दुनिया हो, या क्रिकेट का खुमार, लाइफ़स्टाइल टिप्स हों, या अनोखी-अनूठी ऑफ़बीट ख़बरें, सब मिलेगा यहां-ढेरों फोटो स्टोरी और वीडियो के साथ.

title: Weather Update : राजस्थान में मानसून पूरे परवान पर, 16 जिलों में कहीं-कहीं आज अत्यंत भारी बारिश का अलर्ट - Patrika News
article_text:
Weather Update : राजस्थान में मानसून अब पूरे परवान पर है। मौसम केंद्र ने मंगलवार को कोटा, अजमेर, जोधपुर संभाग के कुछ भागों में भारी, अतिभारी बारिश व कहीं-कहीं अत्यंत भारी बारिश होने का अलर्ट जारी किया है। इसके साथ ही तीन घंटे में 16 जिलों में बारिश का येलो अलर्ट जारी किया है। केंद्र के अनुसार 16 जुलाई को जोधपुर, बीकानेर, अजमेर संभाग के कुछ भागों में भारी और अतिभारी बारिश होने की संभावना है। राज्य में भारी बारिश की गतिविधियों में 17 जुलाई से कमी होगी। मौसम केंद्र के अनुसार पश्चिम राजस्थान दो दिन में मानसून पहुंचेगा।
मौसम विभाग ने राजस्थान में तीन घंटे में 16 जिलों में बारिश का येलो अलर्ट जारी किया है। इसके तहत जयपुर, जयपुर शहर, दौसा, अलवर, भरतपुर, करौली, सवाईमाधोपुर, टोंक, चूरू, झुंझुनूं, सीकर, बीकानेर, श्रीगंगानगर, हनुमानगढ़, नागौर, अजमेर के अलग-अलग स्थानों पर मेघगर्जन के साथ हल्की से मध्यम बारिश होने की संभावना है। साथ ही आकाशीय बिजली चमकेगी। इस दौरान 20-30 KMPH रफ्तार से तेज हवा चलने की संभावना है।
मानसून अब पूरे परवान पर है। प्रदेश के कई इलाकों में तेज बारिश के बाद मानसून जनित हादसों में भी खासी बढ़ोतरी हुई है। कोटा संभाग में चंबल नदी के उफान में छह लोग बह गए। परीक्षा देने गई युवती की नाले में बहने के बाद मौत हो गई है। भारी बारिश के कारण रास्ते बंद होने से मध्यप्रदेश का संपर्क भी कट गया है। क्षेत्र के कई इलाकों में स्कूल-अस्पताल में पानी भर गया है।
सोमवार को कोटा बैराज के गेट खोलकर दो लाख दो हजार क्यूसेक पानी की निकासी की गई। इधर, भीलवाड़ा जिले के दूसरे सबसे बड़े बांध जेतपुरा के सोमवार की दोपहर दो गेट खोले गए। चित्तौड़गढ़ के निलिया महादेव में तीन युवक बह गए। वहीं बिजौलिया में बाढ़ के बाद हालात खराब हो गए हैं। राजसमंद में माछेर में दो कार बही, उदयपुर के मावली में स्कूली बच्चों की बस रेलवे अंडरब्रिज के नीचे फंस गई जिसे ग्रामीणों ने बाहर निकाला।
राज्य में सक्रिय हुए मानसून से भारी बारिश का दौर जारी है। सोमवार को कोटा, उदयपुर, जोधपुर संभाग में कई जगह भारी बारिश हुई। सर्वाधिक बारिश खातोली, कोटा में 198 मिलीमीटर, चित्तौड़गढ़ के भैंसरोडगढ़ में 174, भीलवाड़ा के बिजौलिया में 172, टोंक के दूनी में 146 मिलीमीटर बारिश दर्ज की गई। कोटा में 136 मिलीमीटर बारिश दर्ज की गई। मौसम केंद्र के अनुसार मध्यप्रदेश के ऊपर परिसंचरण तंत्र से कम दबाव का क्षेत्र बन गया है। इसके आगामी 2-3 दिनों में धीरे-धीरे पश्चिमी राजस्थान की ओर आगे बढ़ने की प्रबल संभावना है।
बिजौलिया (भीलवाड़ा) - 9 इंचखातोली (कोटा) - 8 इंचपाली - 8 इंचभैंसरोडगढ़ (चित्तौड़गढ़) - 7 इंचदूनी (टोंक) - 6 इंचआंबा (डूंगरपुर) - 6 इंचआसपुर (डूंगरपुर) - 5 इंचश्रीगंगानगर - 3.5 इंचवनस्थली - 3 इंचडबोक - 3 इंचकरौली - 3 इंच।

title: Rain Alert: इन 2 राज्यों में आज भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश का अलर्ट, जानें दिल्ली-UP समेत देशभर का मौसम - आज तक
article_text:
देश के कई हिस्सों में बारिश अपना रौद्र रूप दिखा रही है. शहर के शहर डूबने को तैयार हैं. जगह-जगह गड्ढों और जलजमाव से लोगों को परेशानी का सामना करना पड़ रहा है. कल राजस्थान में अलग-अलग जगह से मौसम के कहर की डरावनी तस्वीरें आई और आज (15 जुलाई) भी यहां भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश का अलर्ट का अलर्ट है. आइये जानते हैं, देशभर के मौसम का हाल.
इन 2 राज्यों में आज भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश का अलर्ट
मौसम का पूर्वानुमान लगाने वाली एजेंसी, स्काईमेट के मुताबिक, आज पूर्वी राजस्थान और इससे सटे पश्चिम मध्य प्रदेश के हिस्सों में भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश की संभावना है. फिर भारी बारिश की यह प्रणाली धीरे-धीरे राजस्थान के मध्य और पश्चिमी हिस्सों की ओर बढ़ेगी. बांग्लादेश, पश्चिम बंगाल, झारखंड, उत्तर ओडिशा, उत्तर छत्तीसगढ़, पूर्वोत्तर मध्य प्रदेश, कोंकण और गोवा तथा तटीय कर्नाटक में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश के साथ कुछ स्थानों पर भारी बारिश संभव है. हिमाचल प्रदेश, उत्तराखंड और पूर्वोत्तर भारत में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश के साथ एक-दो स्थानों पर तीव्र बारिश हो सकती है.
कहीं-कहीं हल्की बारिश की संभावना
बिहार, उत्तर प्रदेश, दक्षिण छत्तीसगढ़, दक्षिण ओडिशा, केरल, लक्षद्वीप, अंडमान व निकोबार द्वीप समूह और पूर्वी गुजरात के कुछ हिस्सों में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश संभव है. जम्मू-कश्मीर, गिलगित-बाल्टिस्तान, मुजफ्फराबाद, लद्दाख, सौराष्ट्र व कच्छ, मध्य महाराष्ट्र, तटीय आंध्र प्रदेश, आंतरिक कर्नाटक और तमिलनाडु में कहीं-कहीं हल्की बारिश हो सकती है.
राजधानी दिल्ली और इसके आसपास के इलाकों में कभी बारिश तो कभी बादलों की आवाजाही बनी हुई है. सोमवार को जमकर बरसात के बाद आज, मंगलवार को भी दिल्ली-एनसीआर में ऐसा ही मौसम रहने वाला है. मौसम विभाग ने आज दिल्ली के लिए बारिश के साथ आंधी का अलर्ट जारी किया है. तापमान की बात करें तो आज अधिकतम तापमान 33 डिग्री और न्यूनतम तापमान 25 डिग्री सेल्सियस तक रहने की उम्मीद है.

title: Heavy Rain Alert: 48 घंटे तक इन राज्यों में अत्यधिक भारी बारिश, मानसून का रौद्र रूप, IMD अलर्ट | IMD Alert, - Prabhat Khabar
article_text:
Heavy Rain Alert: देश के कई इलाकों में अगले दो दिन भारी बारिश की संभावना है. मौसम विभाग के मुताबिक पूर्वोत्तर राजस्थान और उससे सटे उत्तर-पश्चिम मध्य प्रदेश पर एक स्पष्ट निम्न दबाव का क्षेत्र और दूसरा दक्षिण-पूर्व गंगीय पश्चिम बंगाल और उससे सटे बांग्लादेश पर स्थित है.

Powered By VidCrunch Next Stay Playback speed 1x Normal Quality Auto Back 480p 360p 240p 144p Auto Back 0.25x 0.5x 1x Normal 1.5x 2x / Skip Ads by

Heavy rain alert

IMD के मुताबिक राजस्थान, ओडिशा, गंगीय पश्चिम बंगाल और दक्षिण-पूर्व झारखंड और छत्तीसगढ़ में 15 जुलाई को भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश और कुछ स्थानों पर अत्यंत भारी बारिश की संभावना है.

Heavy rain alert

भारतीय मौसम विज्ञान विभाग के मुताबिक पश्चिमी मध्य प्रदेश और पूर्वी राजस्थान समेत देश के कई हिस्सों में जोरदार बारिश हो सकती है. गुजरात, ओडिशा और पश्चिमी राजस्थान में अलग-अलग स्थानों पर आगामी दिनों में भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश की संभावना है.

Heavy rain alert

मौसम विभाग ने बताया कि अगले कुछ दिनों तक असम-मेघालय, तटीय कर्नाटक, हरियाणा, चंडीगढ़, दिल्ली, हिमाचल प्रदेश, जम्मू-कश्मीर, झारखंड, केरल और माहे, कोंकण और गोवा, मध्य महाराष्ट्र, नागालैंड, मणिपुर, मिजोरम और त्रिपुरा, सौराष्ट्र और कच्छ, उत्तराखंड, पश्चिम बंगाल और सिक्किम और पश्चिमी उत्तर प्रदेश में अलग-अलग स्थानों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है.

Heavy rain alert

मौसम विभाग का अनुमान है कि 15 से 17 जुलाई के दौरान जम्मू-कश्मीर, हिमाचल प्रदेश में भारी बारिश हो सकती है. 19 जुलाई तक उत्तराखंड पंजाब, हरियाणा, चंडीगढ़ और दिल्ली, पश्चिमी उत्तर प्रदेश, पूर्वी उत्तर प्रदेश, राजस्थान, पूर्वी उत्तर प्रदेश में अत्यधिक भारी बारिश की संभावना है.

Heavy rain alert

आईएमडी के मुताबिक अगले 7 दिनों के दौरान पश्चिमी हिमालयी क्षेत्र और मैदानी इलाकों में कई स्थानों पर गरज के साथ बारिश हो सकती है. इस दौरान बिजली गिरने की भी संभावना है.

Heavy rain alert

15 से 17 जुलाई के दौरान पश्चिमी मध्य प्रदेश, पूर्वी मध्य प्रदेश, ओडिशा, छत्तीसगढ़, बिहार, विदर्भ, अंडमान और निकोबार द्वीप समूह, पश्चिम बंगाल, सिक्किम, झारखंड में छिटपुट से लेकर भारी बारिश जारी रह सकती है.

Heavy rain alert

17 से 19 जुलाई के दौरान पूर्वी मध्य प्रदेश, गंगीय पश्चिम बंगाल, 14 से 16 जुलाई के दौरान झारखंड, 14 जुलाई को ओडिशा में बहुत भारी बारिश होने की संभावना है. आईएमडी के मुताबिक अगले 7 दिनों के दौरान इन राज्यों के कई इलाकों पर गरज और बिजली कड़कने की संभावना है.

Heavy rain alert

मौसम विभाग के मुताबिक 16 जुलाई तक गुजरात क्षेत्र में कुछ स्थानों पर भारी बारिश होने की संभावना जताई है. मौसम विभाग का अनुमान है कि अगले 5 दिनों के दौरान इस क्षेत्र में कई स्थानों पर हल्की मध्यम बारिश हो सकती है. कहीं-कहीं भारी बारिश भी हो सकती है.

title: Weather Updates: UP-बिहार और ओडिशा में भारी बारिश की आशंका, हिमाचल में 4 की मौत, जानें अपने राज्य में मौसम का हाल - Mint
article_text:
Weather Today: देश के हर इलाके में मानसूनी बारिश का दौर जारी है। मौसम विभाग ने आज (15 जुलाई 2025) उत्तर प्रदेश, बिहार, हिमाचल, उत्तराखंड, राजस्थान, मध्यप्रदेश में भारी बारिश की आशंका जताई है। वहीं पश्चिम भारत में महाराष्ट्र, गुजरात और गोवा में भी भारी बारिश के आसार हैं। इसके अलावा ओडिशा और गंगीय पश्चिम बंगाल में भारी बारिश हो सकती है। इधर उत्तराखंड के देहरादून और बागेश्वर के लिए भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। हिमाचल प्रदेश में पिछले कई दिनों से आफत की बारिश जारी है।
मौसम विभाग के अनुसार दिल्ली में आज बादल छाए रहेंगे। इसके साथ ही हल्की बारिश होने की संभावना है। इस दौरान 20 से 40 किमी प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज हवाएं चल सकती हैं। आज दिल्ली में अधिकतम तापमान 33 डिग्री सेल्सियस और न्यूनतम तापमान 25 डिग्री सेल्सियस रहने की संभावना है। दिल्ली-एनसीआर के कई इलाकों में सोमवार को बारिश हुई। इनमें नजफगढ़, द्वारका, वसंत विहार, पालम, आर.के.पुरम, डिफेंस कॉलोनी, हौजंखास, लाजपत नगर, मालवीय नगर, तुगलकाबाद और कालकाजी शामिल हैं। इसके अलावा एनसीआर में बहादुरगढ़ में भी हल्की बारिश हुई।
हिमाचल प्रदेश में मानसून कहर बनकर टूट रहा है। पिछले 24 घंटे में बारिश की वजह से अलगअलग घटनाओं में 4 और लोगों की मौत हो गई है। मानसूनी सीजन के दौरान अब तक मृतकों की संख्या 57 पहुं गई है। मीडिया रिपोर्ट्स के मुताबिक, कुल्लू और कांगड़ा जिले में दो लोगों की मौत हुई है। वहीं एक व्यक्ति की बिलासपुर में सांप के काटने से हुई है। एक अन्य व्यक्ति की मौत ऊंचाई से गिरने के कारण हुई है। मौसम विभाग ने शिमला, सोलन और सिरमौर जिले में ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है। यहां भारी बारिश की आशंका जताई गई है।
मौसम विभाग से मिली जानकारी के मुताबिक, उत्तर प्रदेश के कई जिलों में भारी बारिश हो सकती है। इसमें सोनभद्र, मिर्जापुर, चंदौली, वाराणसी, संत रविदास नगर, जौनपुर और गाजीपुर में भारी बारिश के आसार हैं। इसके साथ ही आजमगढ़, मऊ, बलिया, देवरिया, गोरखपुर, संत कबीर नगर, कुशीनगर, अंबेडकर नगर और उसके आसपास के इलाकों में भी भारी बारिश हो सकती है।
बिहार के लिए भी मौसम विभाग ने चेतावनी जारी की है। आरा, पटना, नालंदा, लखीसराय, जमुई, औरंगाबाद, जमुई, रोहतास में भारी बारिश के आसार हैं। वहीं, पश्चिमी चंपारण, पूर्वी चंपारण, सीतामढ़ी, दरभंगा, अररिया, सुपौल, किशनगंज, पूर्णिया, कटिहार, सहरसा, समस्तीपुर, सारण में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश हो सकती है।
मौसम विभाग ने उत्तराखंड के देहरादून और बागेश्वर में बारिश को देखते हुए ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है। राज्य के बाकी जिलों में भी गरज-चमक के साथ बारिश हो सकती है। मौसम विभाग ने कहीं-कहीं आकाशीय बिजली चमकने की चेतावनी भी जारी की है। उत्तराखंड में कहीं-कहीं भारी बारिश का दौर जारी है। देहरादून सहित कई जिलों में धूप और बादलों की आंख-मिचौली चल रही है। वहीं बारिश होने से गर्मी से भी राहत मिली है।
मौसम विभाग के मुताबिक, कोंकण, गोवा, मध्य महाराष्ट्र के घाट के इलाके, सौराष्ट्र, कच्छ में आज भारी बारिश हो सकती है। इसके अलावा आज और कल गुजरात क्षेत्र में भी भारी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की गई है।
मौसम विभाग ने चेतावनी दी है कि उत्तर-पूर्वी राज्यों में अगले 7 दिन तक कई इलाकों में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश हो सकती है। इसके अलावा तेज हवाएं चलने और बिजली गिरने की भी संभावना है। असम, मेघालय, अरुणाचल प्रदेश, मिजोरम और त्रिपुरा के कुछ इलाकों में 15 से 16 जुलाई तक बहुत भारी बारिश हो सकती है। IMD के अनुसार मेघालय में आज (15 जुलाई 2025) भारी बारिश हो सकती है।

title: Weather Update: भारी बारिश से हिमाचल और राजस्थान में नौ लोगों की मौत, अगले तीन दिन भारी वर्षा के आसार - Amar Ujala
article_text:
Weather Update: बारिश से हिमाचल और राजस्थान में नौ लोगों की मौत, अगले तीन दिन भारी वर्षा के आसार
अमर उजाला नेटवर्क, नई दिल्ली Published by: विजय पुंडीर Updated Tue, 15 Jul 2025 07:07 AM IST
सार
61749 Followers
दिल्ली-एनसीआर
हिमाचल प्रदेश, उत्तराखंड, हरियाणा, पश्चिमी उत्तर प्रदेश, छत्तीसगढ़, पश्चिम बंगाल, मध्य महाराष्ट्र, गुजरात राज्य, तमिलनाडु, तटीय और दक्षिण आंतरिक कर्नाटक, पश्चिमी असम और त्रिपुरा में अलग-अलग स्थानों पर भारी वर्षा दर्ज की गई है।
प्रतीकात्मक तस्वीर - फोटो : अमर उजाला
विस्तार
Follow Us

राष्ट्रीय राजधानी समेत देश के कई हिस्सों में उमस भरी गर्मी से राहत दिलाने वाली बारिश हिमाचल प्रदेश में आफत बनी हुई है। प्रदेश में भारी बारिश के कारण चार और लोगों की जान चली गई है, जबकि राजस्थान के कोटा में भारी बारिश के कारण एक जलाशय से पानी छोड़ने के कारण पांच लोग बह गए। पंजाब, हरियाणा और उत्तर प्रदेश से लेकर ओडिशा और पश्चिम बंगाल तक मूसलाधार बारिश हो रही है और कई जगह बाढ़ से हालात गंभीर बने हुए हैं। उत्तर-पश्चिम से लेकर पूर्वी भारत तक अगले तीन दिन भारी वर्षा के आसार हैं।

Trending Videos

भारतीय मौसम विज्ञान विभाग (आईएमडी) की तरफ से जारी नवीनतम आंकड़ों के अनुसार, सोमवार सुबह 8:30 बजे तक बीते 24 घंटों के दौरान ओडिशा के विभिन्न जिलों में 21 सेंटीमीटर तक बारिश दर्ज की गई है। झारखंड, पूर्वी उत्तर प्रदेश, राजस्थान, पश्चिमी मध्य प्रदेश में भी अलग-अलग स्थानों पर 7-20 सेमी तक वर्षा हुई है। हिमाचल प्रदेश, उत्तराखंड, हरियाणा, पश्चिमी उत्तर प्रदेश, छत्तीसगढ़, पश्चिम बंगाल, मध्य महाराष्ट्र, गुजरात राज्य, तमिलनाडु, तटीय और दक्षिण आंतरिक कर्नाटक, पश्चिमी असम और त्रिपुरा में अलग-अलग स्थानों पर भारी वर्षा दर्ज की गई है।

विज्ञापन

हिमाचल प्रदेश राज्य आपदा संचालन केंद्र (एसईओसी) ने बताया कि राज्य के कुल्लू, कांगड़ा और बिलासपुर जिलों में अलग-अलग घटनाओं में चार लोगों की मौत हो गई। राज्य में बारिश, बाढ़ और भूस्खलन के कारण 192 सड़कें बंद हैं जिनमें से ज्यादातर मंडी जिले में हैं। 745 जलापूर्ति योजनाएं और बिजली के 65 ट्रांसफार्मर भी बंद पड़े हैं। 15 जुलाई को भारी बारिश को लेकर सोलन, शिमला और सिरमौर जिलों के लिए ऑरेंज अलर्ट और ऊना, बिलासपुर, हमीरपुर और कुल्लू जिलों के लिए यलो अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। कुल्लू के जवाहड़ के पास बाईपास सड़क धंसे से एक टेंपो खाई में गिर गया और उसका चालक लापता है। सड़क धंसे से मंडी-कुल्लू हाईवे 17 घंटे बंद रहा।

चंबल नदी में बाढ़
राजस्थान में, कोटा जिले के खतौली में 24 घंटों में 198 मिमी बारिश दर्ज की गई, जो राज्य में सबसे ज्यादा है। कोटा बैराज के 12 गेटों से 2.2 लाख क्यूसेक पानी छोड़े जाने के बाद, सोमवार दोपहर चंबल नदी का जलस्तर अचानक बढ़ जाने से पांच युवक बह गए। इनकी पहचान नहीं हो सकी है। मौसम विभाग के अधिकारियों ने कहा कि मध्य प्रदेश में एक चक्रवाती परिसंचरण बना है जिसके प्रभाव से कोटा, अजमेर, जोधपुर और उदयपुर मंडल में रविवार से ही भारी बारिश हो रही है।

दिल्ली में 18.5 मिमी तक बारिश
इसके प्रभाव से दिल्ली में भी भारी बारिश हुई और सोमवार सुबह तक लोधी रोड में 18.5 मिमी वर्षा दर्ज की गई। प्रगति मैदान में 24.3 मिमी बारिश रिकॉर्ड की गई। 

ओडिशा के 30 में से 19 जिलों में भारी बारिश की संभावना 
ओडिशा के 30 में से 19 जिलों में भारी बारिश की संभावना जताई गई है। मौसम विभाग ने अगले 24 घंटे मछुआरों से बंगाल की खाड़ी में नहीं जाने की सलाह दी है। उत्तरी ओडिशा में भारी बारिश के साथ 60 किमी प्रति घंटे तक की रफ्तार से हवाएं भी चलने की संभावना है। मयूरभंज, क्योंझर और सुंदरगढ़ में भारी बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया गया है।

कोलकाता पर अगले 24 घंटे भारी
बंगाल की खाड़ी में बने कम दबाव के क्षेत्र के प्रभाव से कोलकाता और उसके आसपास के क्षेत्रों में अगले 24 घंटे के दौरान भारी बारिश की संभावना जताई गई है। झारखंड के 12 जिलों में आकस्मिक बाढ़ की चेतावनी दी गई है। कुछ निचले इलाकों में जलभराव की भी आशंका जताई गई है। भारी बारिश को लेकर पूर्वी सिंहभूम समेत तीन जिलों के लिए रेड अलर्ट और गुमला समेत तीन जिलों के लिए ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया गया है।

यह भी पढ़ें: Delhi Weather: दिल्ली में काले बादल और पड़ीं राहत ही फुहारें, आज भी राजधानी में हल्की बारिश होने की संभावना

title: भारी बारिश से कई राज्यों में बाढ़ के हालात, उफान पर नदी-नाले - NewsBytes
article_text:
अगली खबर
भारी बारिश से कई राज्यों के बांध ओवरफ्लो हो गए हैं (तस्वीर: एक्स/@annukannu)
भारी बारिश से कई राज्यों में बाढ़ के हालात, उफान पर नदी-नाले 
लेखन
दिनेश चंद शर्मा
Jul 15, 2025
09:02 am
क्या है खबर?

पूरे उत्तर भारत में मानूसनी बारिश जमकर हो रही है। इसके चलते अधिकांश राज्यों में जलभराव से जनजीवन प्रभावित हो रहा है।
भारतीय मौसम विभाग (IMD) ने मंगलवार (15 जुलाई) को दिल्ली समेत राजस्थान, छत्तीसगढ़, हिमाचल प्रदेश, उत्तराखंड और जम्मू-कश्मीर में भारी से भारी बारिश के लिए रेड और ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है।
17 जुलाई तक देश के अधिकांश इलाकों में बारिश के साथ बिजली गिरने और तेज हवाएं चलने का अनुमान व्यक्त किया गया है।


हादसा 

बारिश से 12 लोगों की मौत 

राजस्थान में मानसून चरम पर है। यहां सोमवार से रुक-रुक कर कभी हल्की तो कभी तेज बारिश हो रही है। इससे कई जिलों में बाढ़ जैसे हालात पैदा हो गए हैं।
प्रदेश में बारिश जनित हादसों में पिछले 24 घंटों में 12 लोगों की माैत हो गई, जबकि जयपुर में भारी बारिश के कारण सड़क धंस गई।
कोटा में सबसे ज्यादा 198mm बारिश दर्ज की गई। मंगलवार को कोटा, अजमेर, जोधपुर संभाग में अत्यधिक भारी बारिश का अलर्ट है।


आपने
16%
पढ़ लिया है

ट्विटर पोस्ट

राजस्थान में तेज बारिश से धंसी सड़क

#WATCH | Jaipur, Rajasthan | Road caves near a metro station in Jaipur following heavy rainfall. (14.07) pic.twitter.com/ILNTy808a9

— ANI MP/CG/Rajasthan (@ANI_MP_CG_RJ) July 15, 2025
आपने
33%
पढ़ लिया है

खतरा 

गंगा-यमुना में बढ़ा जलस्तर 

मानसून उत्तर प्रदेश के सभी जिलों में छाया हुआ है। 15 शहरों में तेज बारिश के कारण जलभराव-बाढ़ के हालात हैं और कई बांध ओवरफ्लो होने लगे हैं।
प्रयागराज में गंगा और यमुना नदी उफान पर होने से निचले इलाकों में बाढ़ का खतरा बढ़ गया है।
यहां मंगलवार को बहराइच, बलरामपुर, गोंडा, आजमगढ़, जौनपुर, महाराजगंज, वाराणसी, चंदौली, मिर्जापुर, अंबेडकर नगर, प्रयागराज, बलिया जिलों में भारी बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया गया है।


आपने
50%
पढ़ लिया है

बाढ़ 

मध्य प्रदेश में बाढ़ के हालात 

मध्य प्रदेश में मानसून जमकर बरस रहा है, जिससे नर्मदा नदी खतरे के निशान से ऊपर बह रही है। 10 जिलों में एक सप्ताह से लगातार बारिश के चलते बाढ़ जैसे हालात हैं।
प्रदेश में 15 जुलाई को भी भारी बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया है। इसके अलावा छत्तीसगढ़ में 16-18 जुलाई के दौरान भारी बारिश की संभावना है।
बिहार के आरा, पटना, नालंदा, लखीसराय, जमुई, औरंगाबाद, रोहतास में तेज बारिश हो सकती है।


आपने
66%
पढ़ लिया है

पूर्वानुमान 

दिल्ली में पूरे सप्ताह ऐसा रहेगा मौसम

सावन में दिल्ली में मानसून मेहरबान है। यहां सोमवार को भी बारिश का सिलसिला जारी रहा। इसके चलते कई इलाकों में जलभराव भी देखने को मिला।
मौसम विभाग के अनुसार, राजधानी में पूरे सप्ताह बारिश का दौर जारी रहने का अनुमान है।
समीपवर्ती राज्य हरियाणा में भी जबरदस्त बारिश से कई शहरों में पानी घरों में घुस गया है। पंजाब और हरियाणा में 16-17 जुलाई तक तेज बारिश की संभावना है।


आपने
83%
पढ़ लिया है

आफत 

पहाड़ों पर जारी है आफत की बारिश 

पहाड़ी राज्यों में लगातार बारिश से जनजीवन अस्त-व्यस्त हो गया है। हिमाचल प्रदेश में 17 जुलाई तक बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की गई है। यहां मंगलवार को मंडी, शिमला और सोलन में यलो अलर्ट रहेगा।
दूसरी तरफ उत्तराखंड के देहरादून, बागेश्वर और नैनीताल में भारी बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है।
इसके अलावा जम्मू-कश्मीर के किस्तवाड़, उधमपुर, पुंछ, मीरपुर, राजौरी, रियासी, रामबन, डोडा, कठुआ, सांबा और जम्मू में ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है।


आपने पूरा पढ़ लिया है

title: Monsoon Fury Continues: Heavy Rainfall Triggers Alerts Across Several States - Patrika News
article_text:
Monsoon Rain: Monsoon rains continue across the country. Intermittent rainfall has been reported across many parts of the country for the past 24 hours. Today, a red alert has been issued for Ajmer, Nagaur, and Pali districts of Rajasthan. An alert for extremely heavy rainfall has been issued. The Meteorological Department (IMD) has instructed people in these districts to exercise caution. Meanwhile, a warning for heavy rainfall has also been issued for Bikaner, Jodhpur, and Jalore in Rajasthan. In the past 24 hours, 24 people have died in various incidents due to heavy rainfall in Rajasthan.
There is a possibility of hailstorms in the southern parts of Bihar. The Meteorological Department stated that there is a likelihood of very heavy rainfall at one or two places in Jamui, Nawada, and Gaya districts. An orange alert has been issued in this regard.
Heavy rainfall is occurring in MP. Due to this, the Narmada River is in spate. According to the Water Department, the Narmada is flowing above the danger mark. The Meteorological Department stated that intermittent rainfall has continued for the past seven days in Jabalpur, Rewa, and 10 other districts. Many areas and villages in Sheopur are inundated. Water has accumulated in houses, shops, and even hospitals.
The situation is even worse in Himachal. In the past 24 days, 105 people have died due to rain-related incidents. More than 200 roads in the state are closed. Thousands of transformers have been damaged. The Manali-Chandigarh highway has been closed daily for the past three days due to landslides.
Due to torrential rain, flood-like conditions have developed in several cities of UP. Waterlogging problems have been reported in 15 cities, including Lucknow, Kanpur, and Bareilly. Several dams in the state have overflowed. On Monday, 15 gates of the Govind Sagar dam in Lalitpur were opened.

title: Raj witnesses double rainfall vs 2024, no deficit districts so far - MSN
article_text:
Jaipur: Over three weeks into the southwest monsoon, Rajasthan has recorded significantly improved rainfall, with no district reporting scanty or deficit rain. According to the Jaipur Met office, the state has received an average of 201.63 mm rainfall till Saturday, more than double the 100.65 mm recorded during the same period in 2024.
Officials from the Met office and water resources department told TOI that the monsoon's performance so far has been considerably better than last year. "Baran district, so far, received the highest average rainfall as a rainfall of 529 mm was recorded till Saturday in this district compared to 189.96 mm recorded till July 12, 2024. For this period, Bikaner received the lowest rainfall, which is 95 mm compared to 64 mm recorded till this period," said an officer.
In Jaipur, a rainfall of 259 mm was recorded till Saturday compared to 118 mm of rainfall recorded till July 12, 2024. On the other hand, moderate to heavy showers continued across the state as Sambhar (Jaipur) received a rainfall of 90 mm, which was the highest in the state. The Met office, in its forecast, said that many places in Jaipur, Bikaner, Bharatpur, Kota, and Udaipur divisions of the state are likely to get heavy rainfall on Sunday.
For more news like this visit TOI. Get all the Latest News, City News, India News, Business News, and Sports News. For Entertainment News, TV News, and Lifestyle Tips visit Etimes
India's largest telecom company, Jio, is taking another big step in tech innovation. This time around, the company has introduced JioPC â a cloud-based virtual desktop service that runs through its set-top box. The idea is simple: turn any TV connected to a Jio set-top box into a full-fledged personal computer. With millions of households across the country owning a TV but not a PC, this could be a pretty big deal. All it takes is a keyboard and mouse plugged into the set-top box, and once your invite is approved, you can access a complete desktop interface right on your television. Since it works through the cloud, it can also power basic AI features in future â like smart document tools, virtual learning apps, and more. This service is currently in a free trial and available via waitlist.

title: Rain Alert: IMD, Skymet Issue Heavy To Very Heavy Rainfall Warning For Rajasthan, MP Today; Delhi-NCR Faces Monsoon Disruptions - MSN
article_text:
With continuous monsoon rains pounding parts of India, leading to extensive waterlogging and disruption, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) and private weather forecaster Skymet have sounded heavy to very heavy rain predictions in certain areas today, July 15.
East Rajasthan and surrounding West Madhya Pradesh would be getting heavy to very heavy rainfall today, reports Skymet Weather. This heavy rain system is then predicted to slowly move towards the western and central regions of Rajasthan.
Light to moderate rain with scattered heavy rain is likely over:
Light to moderate rain can be expected in scattered parts of:
National Capital Region (NCR) is still witnessing scattered rain and overcast skies. Following heavy rain on Monday, Delhi-NCR is likely to witness the same weather today, Tuesday. The IMD has put out a 'rain with thunderstorm' warning for Delhi today. Weather in the capital is likely to be around a maximum of 33 degrees Celsius and minimum of 25 degrees Celsius.
Governments in various states, such as Rajasthan, are struggling with flood-like conditions, and people are requested to take precautions and remain informed about local weather alerts.
Beginning of dialog window. Escape will cancel and close the window.
Television actress Pallavi Rao, known for her role in TV shows including Pandya Store, has recently parted ways from her director husband, Suraj Rao. The TV actress announced that she and Suraj are heading for a divorce after 22 years of marriage.
In a recent interview with ETimes, Pallavi announced the separation and revealed that the former couple have mutually decided to part ways. The TV actor cited 'compatibility issues' as the reason for their divorce. She claimed that they have been facing marital woes for the past few years. She also claimed to have taken the ‘tough decision’ to live a peaceful life.
Pallavi said, “We had compatibility issues for the past few years and have now finally decided to part ways. It was a tough decision because we have a 21-year-old daughter and an 18-year-old son."
She added, “Sometimes, it’s better to part ways amicably and choose to live a peaceful life. I respect Suraj and will always wish well for him.” The former couple parted ways two weeks ago and have been living apart since.
For the unversed, Pallavi Rao and Suraj Rao met for the first time on the set in Mumbai and sparked an instant connection. They tied the knot in 2003 in the presence of their close ones. The duo share two kids together, a 21-year-old daughter and an 18-year-old son.
Also Read: Ram Gopal Varma reacts to Deepika Padukone–Sandeep Reddy Vanga 8-hour shift controversy, calls it 'Exaggerated’
On the work front, Pallavi has been working in TV shows for the last two decades. Besides Pandya Store, she is also known for her roles in TV serials, like Yeh Jhuki Jhuki Si Nazar, Qayamat Se Qayamat, and Diya Aur Baati Hum. Meanwhile, Suraj has directed some of the iconic shows like Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, Shaka Laka Boom Boom, and more.

title: Death Toll Reaches 105 in Himachal: 12 Dead Due to Heavy Rain in Rajasthan; Narmada River Flows Above Dange... - Bhaskar English
article_text:
English News

National

12 Dead Due To Heavy Rain In Rajasthan; Death Toll Reaches 105 In Himachal; Narmada River Flows Above Danger Mark In MP

Monsoon 2025 16 dead due to heavy rain in Rajasthan: Narmada flows above danger mark in MP; roads to 4 bridges washed away in UP before inauguration

3 minutes ago



Copy link

Torrential monsoon rains continue to wreak havoc across several northern states, leading to widespread flooding, infrastructure damage, and fatalities.

Rajasthan: 16 dead in 24 hours, Kota barrage gates opened

Heavy rainfall has created a flood-like situation in Rajasthan, claiming 16 lives in the last 24 hours in rain-related incidents across the state. Kota recorded the highest rainfall on Monday with 198 mm, prompting authorities to open 12 gates of the Kota Barrage to release excess water.

Madhya Pradesh: Narmada above danger mark, floods in 10 districts

In Madhya Pradesh, the Narmada river is now flowing above the danger mark, as heavy rain has persisted for a week in districts including Jabalpur and Rewa. Several villages and areas in Sheopur were surrounded by water on Monday, with homes, shops, and even hospitals submerged, worsening the flood crisis.

Uttar Pradesh: Waterlogging in 15 cities, roads washed away in Chitrakoot

In Uttar Pradesh, heavy rains have resulted in waterlogging and urban flooding across 15 cities, including Lucknow, Kanpur, and Bareilly. Overflowing dams have added to the crisis, and in Lalitpur, 17 gates of the Govind Sagar Dam were opened on Monday. In Chitrakoot, the approach roads to four newly constructed bridges worth ₹51 crore were washed away before their official inauguration.

Himachal Pradesh: 105 deaths in 24 days, over 200 roads still shut

Meanwhile, Himachal Pradesh continues to suffer from severe monsoon impacts. In the past 24 days, 105 people have died in rain, flood, and landslide-related incidents. Over 200 roads remain blocked, and the Manali-Chandigarh highway has been shut daily for the past three days due to recurring landslides.

Pictures different states

In Lalitpur, Uttar Pradesh, 17 out of 18 gates of the Govind Sagar Dam were opened.

In Bathinda, Punjab, due to continuous rainfall, a school van broke down. The van driver was seen carrying a schoolchildthrough waist-deep water.

In Guwahati, Assam, roads were waterlogged following heavy rainfall.

In Prayagraj, the Ganga and Yamuna rivers are in spate. Water has flooded the open gym located along the riverbanks.

article_text:
By Nidhi Giri
Tue, 15 Jul 2025 07:30 AM (IST)
Source:JND
RELATED ARTICLES

Weather Alert: According to IMD, rain activity will continue in North India including Delhi-NCR. As per the weather body, heavy showers are expected to lash Delhi-NCR on Tuesday, July 15. IMD has issued heavy rain warnings in Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh for Tuesday. Heavy rain alert has been issued in 13 districts of Uttar Pradesh.

The Meteorological Department has forecast heavy rains in Bahraich, Balrampur, Gonda, Azamgarh, Jaunpur, Maharajganj, Varanasi, Chandauli, Mirzapur, Ambedkar Nagar, Chandauli, Prayagraj, and Ballia.

In Bihar, there may be heavy rain in Ara, Patna, Nalanda, Lakhisarai, Jamui, Aurangabad, and Jamui.

Himachal Pradesh Weather

Rain has been lashing hilly states as well. Rain warning has been issued in Himachal Pradesh till July 17. A yellow alert for rain in Mandi, Shimla and Solan districts.

Uttarakhand Weather

An orange alert has been issued for heavy rain in Dehradun, Bageshwar and Nainital in Uttarakhand. Apart from this, light rain is also expected in other districts of the state.

MP And Rajasthan Weather

For Rajasthan, IMD has issued a red alert for Kota, Jaipur, Ajmer, Jaipur and Jodhpur divisions.

Maharashtra And Goa Weather

title: IMD Issues Heavy Rain Alert in Rajasthan - Patrika News
article_text:
Life in Rajasthan has been disrupted due to heavy rainfall. The Chief Minister has had to personally monitor the situation. School closures have begun due to waterlogging caused by the rain. Today, 15th July, private and government schools in Pali and Kota cities are closed. A red alert for heavy rain remains in effect for these cities. If heavy rain continues, closures may extend to tomorrow. It is expected that rainfall will reduce from 17th July, continuing at a lower intensity for the following days. The system, active for two days, has caused widespread flooding in southern and eastern Rajasthan. Heavy rain has inundated roads in several districts, leading to waterlogging in low-lying areas and disruption of traffic.
The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a warning of heavy to very heavy rainfall for several districts over the next 48 hours. Torrential rain is particularly expected in parts of Kota, Ajmer, Udaipur, and Jaipur divisions. There is a risk of extremely heavy rainfall in some areas, potentially leading to flood-like situations. State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) teams have been deployed across the state for relief and rescue operations. These teams have already saved numerous lives in recent days. According to the IMD, a new monsoon system has become fully active in the last 24 hours and is moving towards western Rajasthan. Although rainfall activity is expected to decrease slightly from 17th July, the administration has been instructed to remain fully vigilant until then.
Pali city in Rajasthan has experienced intense rainfall in the last 24 hours. Some areas received up to ten inches of rain, while the city's average rainfall was recorded at eight inches. Between 8 am and 5 pm, rainfall was recorded as follows: Rot (27 mm), Bali (38 mm), Sojat (52 mm), Sumerpur (13 mm), Rani (31 mm), Desuri (11 mm), and Marwar Junction (27 mm). A heavy to very heavy rainfall alert remains in effect for the city.
Considering the heavy rainfall and waterlogging in Kota district, District Collector Piyush Samariya, exercising the powers conferred under the Kota Disaster Management Act, 2005, has declared a public holiday for all government and private schools in Kota district on 15th July for students only. Teaching and non-teaching staff are expected to report for duty as usual.

title: Heavy Rain Alert: There will be heavy rain in these states for the next 7 days, know the weather condition ... - informalnewz
article_text:
Heavy Rain Alert: The low pressure area formed in the Bay of Bengal is moving towards the west-north. It may turn into a depression in Gangetic West Bengal in the next 24 hours. Due to its effect, extremely heavy rains are expected in Odisha, West Bengal and Jharkhand today.

Rainfall Alert: Heavy rain is expected for the next few days due to active monsoon and weather systems in different parts of the country. According to the Meteorological Department, the monsoon trough is active and a low pressure area is formed in parts of Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh. It will move towards Rajasthan for the next two days. Due to its effect, extremely heavy rain is likely at different places in Rajasthan on 15 and 16 July. Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir will receive heavy rains between July 15 and 21. During this period, a warning of light to moderate rain with thunder has been issued.

The low pressure area formed in the Bay of Bengal and adjoining areas is moving towards west-north. It may turn into a depression in Gangetic West Bengal in the next 24 hours. Due to its effect, extremely heavy rains are likely in Odisha, West Bengal and Jharkhand today. Heavy to very heavy rains are expected in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Bihar and Jharkhand between July 15 and 20. In Northeast India, Assam, Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh, Mizoram and Tripura will receive heavy rains during July 15 and 16. Light to moderate rains with thunderstorms are likely.

4 people died due to rain in Himachal

4 people died due to rain havoc in Himachal Pradesh. 5 people were swept away due to the release of water from a reservoir after heavy rains in Kota, Rajasthan. More than 200 roads are closed for vehicular traffic in Himachal Pradesh, most of them in Mandi. Flash flood warning has been issued in 12 districts of Jharkhand. The State Emergency Operations Centre said that a total of two people drowned including one each in Kullu and Kangra districts. One person died of snakebite in Bilaspur and another died after falling from a height. Since the onset of monsoon on June 20, 61 people have died in rain-related incidents in the state.

Heavy rain in Kota, Rajasthan

Khatauli in Kota district of Rajasthan recorded 198 mm rainfall in the last 24 hours, which is the highest rainfall in the state. Five youths were swept away in the Chambal river on Monday afternoon due to sudden rise in the water level after water was released from the Kota barrage. Digod police station in-charge Purushottam Mehta said, ‘The five missing youths have not been identified yet and the youths rescued are not in a position to give detailed information at this time.’ In another incident, a 27-year-old woman was swept away while trying to cross a swollen drain on a scooter in the district. At the same time, it rained in Delhi in the evening, which brought relief from the humid heat of the day. However, complaints of waterlogging and traffic jams were also received at some places.

title: IMD issues Red, Orange alerts for heavy rainfall in multiple states on 15 July; Delhi-NCR to see rain, thunderstorms - Mint
article_text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued multiple Red and Orange Alerts for heavy to extremely heavy rainfall across key states including Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and parts of Jammu and Kashmir. The weather office has also forecast rain with thunderstorms for Delhi-NCR between July 15 and 17, as widespread rainfall accompanied by lightning and strong winds is expected over large parts of India in the coming days.
The IMD has issued Red Alert for extremely heavy rainfall in Nagaur, Pali, Ajmer in Rajasthan, and in Jashpur, Balrampur, and Surajpur.
Orange Alert for heavy rainfall has been issued in Shimla, Solan, Bageswar, Dehradun, Sirmaur, Chamoli. In Jammu and Kashmir, several districts have also been placed under Orange Alert – Kistwar, Udhampur, Poonch, Mirpur, Rajouri, Reasi, Ramban, Doda, Kathua, Samba, Jammu.
Further, Orange Alert has also been issued by IMD for Bikaner, Jodhpur, Barmer, Jalore, Sirohi, Rajsamand, Bhilwara, Tonk, Bundi, Kota, Chittorgarh, Dhar.
In the East, Orange alert issued for East Khasi Hills, Surguja, Bhagalpur, Begusarai, Saharsa, Patna, Paschim Singhbhumi, Kendujhar, Raigarg, Sundargarh, Jharsuguda, Mayurbhanj, Sambalpur, Garhwa, Palamu, Latehar, Chatra, Gaya, Aurangabad, Nawada, Jamui, Banka, Nalanda.
Delhi will witness a generally cloudy sky. Occasionally strong surface winds 20-30 kmph gusting to 40 kmph Very light to light rain accompanied with thunderstorms/lightning. The maximum and minimum temperatures over Delhi are likely to be in the range of 32 to 34°C and 24 to 26°C respectively. The minimum temperature will be below normal up to 1 to 2°C, and the maximum temperature will be below normal up to 1 to 2°C. The predominant surface wind will likely be from the southeast direction with a wind speed of less than 20 kmph during the morning hours. The wind speed will gradually increase becoming less than 25 kmph from the southeast direction in the afternoon. It will decrease becoming less than 15 kmph from the southeast direction during the evening and night.
On 16 July, national capital Delhi will see partly cloudy sky. Very light to light rain accompanied with thunderstorms/lightning. The maximum and minimum temperatures over Delhi are likely to be in the range of 33 to 35°C and 24 to 26°C respectively. The minimum temperature will be below normal up to 1 to 3°C, and the maximum temperature will be below normal up to 1 to 2°C. The predominant surface wind will likely be from the southeast direction with a wind speed of less than 12 kmph during the morning hours. The wind speed will gradually increase becoming less than 15 kmph from the southeast direction in the afternoon. It will decrease becoming less than 12 kmph from the southeast direction during the evening and night.
Partly cloudy sky predicted in Delhi. Very light to light rain accompanied with thunderstorms/lightning. The maximum and minimum temperatures over Delhi are likely to be in the range of 33 to 35°C and 24 to 26°C respectively. The minimum temperature will be below normal up to 1 to 2°C and the maximum temperature will be below normal up to 2 to 4°C. The predominant surface wind will likely be from the south direction with a wind speed of less than 12 kmph during the morning hours. The wind speed will gradually increase becoming less than 18 kmph from the southeast direction in the afternoon. It will decrease becoming less than 15 kmph from the northeast direction during the evening and night.

title: People trapped in homes, crocodiles in flooded streets in Kota: Dozens of colonies face shortage of essenti... - Bhaskar English
article_text:
English News

Local

Rajasthan

Kota

People Trapped In Homes Crocodiles In Flooded Streets In Kota Dozens Of Colonies Face Shortage Of Essentials And Flood like Situation

Ground Report People trapped in homes, crocodiles in flooded streets in Kota: Dozens of colonies face shortage of essentials and flood-like situation

Kota 1 hour ago



Copy link

Kota has been receiving heavy rainfall for two days, with 136 mm recorded in 24 hours. Several colonies face flood-like conditions, leaving people trapped in their homes. Crocodiles were seen swimming in water-filled streets.

Residents couldn’t get milk or vegetables, and many missed work. It rained continuously from Sunday morning through Monday. The Bhaskar team visited affected areas to assess the situation.

There was no other way, so the Bhaskar reporter had to wade through water to reach people trapped in their homes.

Possibility of crocodiles

The Bhaskar team visited Balaji Awas Third on Borkheda Road, part of the Smart City project, where houses were surrounded by water. A resident warned the reporter not to come due to knee-deep water and possible crocodiles.

Still, the reporter waded through to find two houses facing each other, beyond which access was completely blocked. Residents had been trapped for two days, unable to walk or use vehicles.

People unable to go to work

Balaji Nagar Third resident Vijay Singh Hada is also the secretary of the Local Development Committee. His house is surrounded by water. The only way to come and go is through waist-deep water.He said,

It has been two days, and the water level is increasing instead of decreasing. The situation here becomes such that water enters inside the houses. People have to live on rooftops. For two days, they have been confined in the house with children. Water started filling here from Saturday night. On Sunday morning, the milkman refused to come to the house. In such a situation, on Monday, milk was kept at a house located on the road so that they could at least get milk by going through the water. I work in property but have been sitting at home for two days. Had to make my daughter skip college on Monday too. Crocodiles also come in the water. Baby crocodiles were seen here on Monday morning itself. It's scary to even step out in such conditions.

Fitness coach Ajay Singh, who lives across from Vijay Singh’s house, said he has lived there for six to seven years. Every monsoon, they either get trapped at home or have to move to relatives’ places. Last year, water had entered their houses, and this year the situation is repeating, with water levels rising steadily.

A crocodile on the wall of a plot amidst waterlogged Balaji Nagar Third.

Families waiting on rooftops for water to recede

Rajesh Saxena, a resident of Balaji Nagar Third, said his house has been surrounded by water for three days. Speaking to Rajesh Sharma, he mentioned being unable to go to his coaching center job due to the flooding. He also highlighted the threat of crocodiles in the water, a concern shared in nearby Shiv Colony and Balaji Awas.

Rajesh said,

While they have rations, if there's an emergency, it's impossible to leave the house.

There is no path left for coming and going due to water. Children cannot go to school-college and adults cannot go to office.

Residents angry about administration's negligence

Resident Sunita said,

No development work has been done here till date. Despite being in Kota city, the conditions are worse than villages.

Gayatri Malav said,

We have been living here for seven years. This problem occurs every year. Everyone knows about the situation but there is no one to look into it. When water is filled, all movement stops. Power gets cut off. We remain stranded in darkness amidst the water.

Water accumulated around the transformer. This could cause a major accident anytime.

Same situation in most colonies

Around a dozen colonies on Devli Arab Road, including Balaji Aawas and Nayapura’s lower settlements, face flood-like conditions during rains, worsened after Beraj gates are opened.

Even posh areas like Pratap Colony in Borkheda are not spared; although water has receded there, broken roads and repeated flooding remain persistent issues.

Deepak Namdev, President of Borkheda Trade Development Committee, said a local drain overflows during rains, causing water to enter colonies and creating flood-like conditions yearly.

Boats are often used to rescue and shift residents, but authorities continue to neglect the issue despite recurring crises.

Waterlogging affects areas like Kautilya Nagar, Milat Nagar, Balaji Aawas (all floors), Shiv Colony, and Shiv Vihar, where residents like Shahida report no proper roads and expect the situation to persist for 20–25 days.

A car was swept away in strong current at RIICO-Ranpur bridge. However, the driver jumped out in time.

Temple surrounded by drain water, car swept away in Ranpur

Meanwhile, near Thekda bridge, drain water has reached the Raktya Bheru temple located near Borkheda Link Road (canal). The drain water has reached all around and inside the temple. Temple priest Gopal was found cleaning water in the temple. When asked, he said this problem occurs every year. The drain water comes directly into the temple.

Rajesh Bai, who serves in the temple, said,

The water level has receded now, otherwise it reaches up to the idol inside. There is so much filth outside the temple, but no one pays attention.

On Monday in Ranpur, overflow from the pond flooded the RIICO industrial area. A car was swept away at the RIICO-Ranpur bridge, but the occupants escaped just in time before it got stuck in a drain.

Water filled in temple premises. Due to this, devotees are unable to come for darshan.

Boat for rescue After increased water inflow in settlements located at Devli Arab Road, fire department's diving teams arrived late in the evening. Boats were deployed at Devli Arab Road and Devli Arab so that people who want to evacuate could be rescued.

Boats were launched in Devli Arab Road and Devli Arab.

title: In daring rescue, students carry two pregnant teachers to safety in flood-hit Mandi - Tribune India
article_text:
In a remarkable act of courage and compassion, two pregnant teachers from the College of Horticulture and Forestry in Thunag, Mandi district, were carried to safety on foot through treacherous terrain by their students and colleagues. Their heroic efforts not only saved the lives of the expectant mothers but also helped bring two newborns into the world.

Advertisement

Dr Neha Thakur delivered a healthy baby boy on July 8 at the Civil Hospital in Sundernagar, Mandi, while Dr Sarita gave birth to a baby girl on July 12 at Sai Hospital in Hamirpur. Without this daring rescue, the lives of both mothers and their unborn children could have been in grave danger.

Advertisement

The rescue took place amid the devastation caused by relentless rains in the Seraj region, which severed road access, disrupted power and water supplies and left over 115 homes and 100 shops damaged. Tragically, five lives were lost in Thunag alone. Stranded in the disaster-stricken area, Dr Neha and Dr Sarita, both nearing their due dates, urgently needed medical care.

With roads impassable and emergency services unable to reach the remote college, students and faculty members banded together on July 2 for an extraordinary mission. They fashioned makeshift palanquins and embarked on an arduous 11-km trek from Thunag to Bagsyad, navigating dangerous mountain paths, swollen streams and unstable terrain.

Leading the heroic effort were students, including Prikshit Verma, Shivang, Tushar Thakur, Uday Thakur, Dipak Thakur, Aryan, Vineet, Aryan Atri, Ayushman and others. They not only carried the palanquins but also provided unwavering moral support and protection throughout the perilous journey. The two teachers displayed incredible resilience, walking stretches where the path was too narrow or hazardous even for a makeshift stretcher.

Advertisement

Faculty members such as Dr Himani, Dr Rajat, Dr Ajinder, Dr Jai Pal, Dr Kishore Sharma, Dr Kishore Thakur, Dr Vijay Rana, Kuldeep and Neem Chand played crucial roles in the operation. Dean Dr PL Sharma oversaw the entire effort, ensuring coordination and safety amid the chaos.

This inspiring act of humanity has drawn widespread admiration, with messages of praise and gratitude flooding social media. In a time marked by destruction and despair, the courage of the students, faculty, and the unwavering strength of the two mothers gave the region a reason to celebrate new life and hope.

title:
Depression rains likely to trigger
flooding in Odisha: IMD - The New Indian Express
article_text:
BHUBANESWAR: A depression formed over Bay of Bengal on Monday which could trigger very heavy rainfall and lead to flood-like situation in the state, said the India Meteorological Department (IMD).
The national weather forecaster said a low pressure area formed over Bay of Bengal on Sunday evening. It intensified into a well-marked low pressure area in the wee hours of Monday and then into a depression over south-east Gangetic West Bengal and adjoining Bangladesh later in the day. It is likely to move west-northwestwards across Gangetic West Bengal during the next 24 hours.
Under the influence of the system, Mandira dam near Kansbahal in Sundargarh district received extremely heavy showers and recorded 220 mm rains in the last 24 hours ending at 8.30 am on the day. The IMD further predicted that very heavy rainfall (115.6 mm to 204.4 mm) to extremely heavy rainfall (204.5 mm or more) may occur in Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar and Sundargarh districts between Monday and Tuesday morning.
Heavy to very heavy rain (64.5 mm to 204.4 mm), thunderstorm, lightning and gusty surface wind speeds reaching 30 kmph to 40 kmph is likely to occur at Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar, Sundargarh, Sambalpur and Jharsuguda districts on Tuesday, while Balasore, Bhadrak, Jajpur, Dhenkanal, Angul, Deogarh, Bargarh, Sonepur, Boudh, Balangir and Nuapada districts may experience heavy rainfall (64.5 mm to 115.5 mm) during the period.
IMD DG Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said depression-induced rains during the monsoon season usually trigger flood-like situations in Odisha. “The state has been experiencing intensified rainfall activity in the last 15 to 20 days due to the back-to-back weather systems.
There was a flood in Subarnarekha and Budhabalanga rivers recently. The depression may trigger a flood-like situation in Subarnarekha, Budhabalanga, upper and lower catchment areas of Mahanadi as well in Brahmani and Baitarani rivers,” he added.
Mohapatra further warned that the low-lying areas of the cities experiencing heavy rains may get inundated. He also advised fishermen not to venture into the sea along and off north Odisha, West Bengal and Bangladesh coasts during the next 24 hours.
As squally wind speeds reaching 40 kmph to 50 kmph and gusting up to 60 kmph is likely to prevail in the region, a local cautionary signal -III warning has been hoisted for the ports in the state.

article_text:
Southern states will experience a prolonged wet spell, with Kerala, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka expected to receive heavy to very heavy rainfall (Photo Source: Pexels)

India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an extensive weather update as multiple weather systems continue to influence widespread rainfall activity across India. With active monsoon troughs and two well-marked low-pressure areas, states across the northwest, east, central, west, northeast, and southern India are expected to witness varied intensity of showers, including extremely heavy rainfall in several regions. Delhi-NCR will also experience overcast skies with light to moderate rain over the next few days. Here are the details

Northwest India: Rajasthan, Himachal & Uttarakhand on Alert

Under the impact of a well-marked low-pressure system over northeast Rajasthan and adjoining northwest Madhya Pradesh, the northwest region is likely to receive widespread rainfall with very heavy showers over the next few days. States such as Rajasthan, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand are on high alert for extreme rainfall events, especially between July 15 and July 17.

East & Central India: Multiple States to See Intense Showers

title: Rain renders over 200 roads unnavigable in Himachal; flash flood warning for half of Jharkhand - Daily Excelsior
article_text:
NEW DELHI, Jul 14: More than 200 roads were out of bounds for vehicular traffic in Himachal Pradesh, a majority of them in Mandi, because of the havoc caused by rain, while a flash flood warning was issued for 12 districts in Jharkhand on Monday.

Delhi got a decent drizzle towards the evening, lifting the heavy humid pall it sweltered under during the day.

According to IMD data, Lodhi Road recorded the highest cumulative rainfall at 18.5 mm till 8.30 am on Monday.

Pragati Maidan received 24.3 mm of rain, Ayanagar, 15.5 mm, Safdarjung, 15.8 mm, and Palam, 8.5 mm.

In Himachal Pradesh, 208 roads, including 157 in the disaster-hit Mandi district, are closed for vehicular traffic, while 745 water supply schemes and 139 power distribution transformers were affected.

The local Met office has issued an Orange alert of heavy to very heavy rain in Kangra, Mandi and Sirmaur on Monday, and Shimla, Solan, and Sirmaur on Tuesday.

It issued a Yellow alert, meaning heavy rain, for at least three of the 12 districts till Friday.

In Odisha, the weather department forecasted heavy rainfall in 19 of the 30 districts, as a low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal intensified into a well-marked system.

The India Meteorological Department cautioned fishermen not to venture into the sea for the next 24 hours in the north Bay of Bengal, as squally winds, blowing at 40-50 kmph, gusting to 60 kmph, were likely to prevail along and off north Odisha.

A red warning was issued for extremely heavy rain, above 20 centimetres, in Mayurbhanj, Keonhar and Sundargarh. Dhenkanal, Jajpur, Kendrapara, Bhadrak and Balasore were predicted to receive 12 cm to 20 cm of rain. The remaining districts were forecasted to witness 7-11 cm of precipitation.

Kolkata is likely to experience spells of light to moderate rain or thundershowers over the next 24 hours.

Light to moderate rain is likely across South Bengal districts, as a cyclonic circulation over the Bay of Bengal is set to intensify into a low-pressure area within the next 24 hours, according to the Regional Meteorological Centre here.

In Jharkhand, a flash flood warning was issued for Bokaro, East Singhbhum, Garhwa, Gumla, Khunti, Latehar, Lohardaga, Palamu, Ranchi, Saraikela, Simdega, and West Singhbhum districts till 11.30 am on Tuesday.

“Surface runoff and inundation may occur in some low-lying areas,” the IMD said.

A Red alert was sounded for heavy to extremely heavy rain in Saraikela-Kharswan, East Singhbhum, and West Singhbhum districts, and an Orange alert for Gumla, Khunti, and Simdega districts till 8.30 am on Tuesday.

The weather office has issued a Yellow alert for heavy rain in Ranchi, Lohardaga, Ramgarh, Bokaro, Dhanbad, Jamtara, Hazaribag, Giridih, Koderma, and Deoghar till 8.30 am tomorrow.

Ranchi Meteorological Centre Deputy Director Abhishek Anand said the state is likely to experience a widespread rainfall till July 17 under the influence of a depression and monsoon trough. (PTI)

title: Humanity still alive! Men rush to fish out calf from floodwaters, watch - Odisha TV
article_text:
Animals get swept away by floodwaters. As animal rescue is often treated as secondary, many animals lose their lives. However, certain kind-hearted individuals risk their lives to save animals.
Credit: X/Dr Suman (screengrab)
Humanity still alive! Men rush to fish out calf from floodwaters, watch
Millions of people are affected in India every year by the recurring floods. While human toll often makes headlines, the natural disaster also wreaks havoc on animals, both domestic and wild animals, which is largely overlooked. Animals get swept away by rising waters. As animal rescue is often treated as secondary, many animals lose their lives. However, certain kind-hearted individuals risk their lives to save animals.
Recently, a video has gone viral on social media that shows a group of men risking their lives to rescue of calf stuck in floodwaters.
In the viral video, a young man can be seen walking on a submerged bridge, followed by another. Suddenly, a calf is seen popping its head above the water surface in floodwater. The calf was struggling to jump to safety. But, due to the current of flowing floodwater, it fails. Moreover, the flowing floodwater on the bridge prevented it from getting onto it.
Meanwhile, one of the men bends down while stretching his hand towards the calf. It grabs the calf and pulls it out of the water with the help of other men. At one moment, the exhausted calf trembles and falls even after climbing the bridge. But the saviours safeguard the calf and help it to make its way to safety.
इंसानियत अभी भी कुछ लोगो मे जिंदा है। 🥹❤️
जानवरों के प्रति प्यार और करुणा रखें 🙏🏻 pic.twitter.com/JVh8z2hr10
While the origin of the video couldn't be verified, it is shared on X by Dr Suman. The video has gone viral, amassing massive views and likes. Moreover, netizens have lauded the efforts of the men to rescue the calf from the floodwaters.
